alert.note: Alert for Cullman; DeKalb; Jackson; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marshall, south central Jackson, DeKalb, northeastern Cullman and southeastern Morgan Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arab, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Fort Payne, Guntersville, Arab, Rainsville, Henagar, Crossville, Sylvania, Fyffe and Powell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama.
